Interested in joining our newsletter mailing list...?

Each year Asset Edge hold user group conferences in various locations across Australia. We aim to share the latest enhancements of the core solutions in use across our customer base and provide a forum for discussion which guides future development of these solutions.

We promote the inventiveness of other councils with their extensive usage of the Reflect product across countless Asset types. Our UGC's run over 1.5 days and our Conference Dinner allows time for everyone to socialise.
Maybe we'll see you at next years conference?
to go directly to our Conference News page

Asset Edge hold annual user group conferences across various locations across Australia generally around April / May each year. We aim to showcase new features / functions that we have developed into our product range, providing you with opportunity to see and hear all about 'our achievements' that you may hopefully implement back at your council. During the conference councils have opportunity to contribute to the direction of our products, we ask - what would you like?
To view more about our conferences - click
Keep up to date with what's happening with Asset Edge and our clients.
to find our latest 'OnThe Edge' and 'Queensland Focus' newsletters.
Learn more about how Asset Edge have assisted our customers implement mobile software solutions.
Book RMCC and RMPC Refresher Training Today

Asset Edge consultants are available to facilitate RMCC / RMPC specific training sessions to suit your councils needs. Our RMCC / RMPC consultants hold a broad knowledge base on RMCC / RMPC requirements and practices and can provide your council staff with productive learning sessions.

The Civica Group, an international market leader in business-critical software applications, digital solutions and managed services, today announced that local subsidiary Civica Pty Ltd has acquired Asset Edge Pty Ltd. which specialises in providing SaaS web and mobile applications for Asset Inspection and Maintenance Management.

With the expansion and improvements to Australia's digital networks Field Service Software tools are quickly becoming the efficient and effective method to capture data for many organisations. Asset Edge is an Australian owned company and provides solutions to Local, State and Federal Government Authorities.  Our company specialises in developing fully mobile software applications that interact with an office based systems using the latest available technologies in the IT industry.  Asset Edge's commitment to ensuring its products meet the goals of its clients has seen our continual growth across Australia.  We are proud to have been listed as one of the "10 Most Promising Field Services Solution Providers 2017".
Natural Disaster Management preparation can only be enhanced by having a Natural Disaster Management Solution on standby ready to use if an event of natural devastation should occur.

RECOVER was designed for Local and State Government use and is free* to all councils in Australia. It is widely used by Local Government for data collection and reporting of asset damage that has occurred from floods, storms, bushfies, cyclones and other natural disaster events. Recover will provide your staff with the immediate ability to record the damage against the asset, take photos and estimate damage costs which then becomes components for the compensation claim under the Disaster Recovery Funding Arrangements (DRFA) overseen by respective Authorities.
For more information on Recover - please click on the heading title (hyperlink) above
* refer pay per event information within Recover information sheet

Registrations for our Annual User Group Conferences for 2019 are now open.  Seven venues across 3 states will provide attendees with the lastest product enhancements, an insight into some of the inspiring achievements and usage of our products by other clients and also provides the chance for you to speak with our Asset Edge consultants and other council staff.   For more information on this years User Group Conferences - click here.
Our Support servicese are available Monday to Friday* from 9am - 5pm AEST**.   Please call 1300 219 552 or email support@assetedge.com.au
(*excluding Public Holidays) (**DST applies for all support when DST is active for southern states)

We have also recently introduced Request Forms where additional services for your organisation - such as new database creation, mapping/chainage work or major database/software work is required to be undertaken by our team.
These forms will formalise any work to be undertaken by Asset Edge for your organisation.
Please click on the 'Service Requests' title above to
Asset Edge provides a wide-range of training options for the full range of our products. Consultants can provide workplace onsite training to suit your needs.

Our new Maroochydore Office can now accomodate small group training.  Should you prefer to visit us, let us know, we would be happy to provide requested training for your Council.  Shortly we will be releasing a training program for small groups to be held in our Maroochydore Training Facility.  Small group sessions will be held for: Recover, Reflect Basic, Reflect Administrator, Reflect - builid a new database, Reflect RMPC.

Regular training sessions allows your work teams and administrative staff to acquire further skills and valuable knowledge of new functionality that has been introduced to our products allowing significant gains in efficiencies to the workplace.  Whether you need training in Android or would like training on filters, reports or templates - just let us know.
Please click on the title  'Training Services'  above to view our training options or call us on 1300 219 552 to discuss your training requirements.

Online training videos are created to assist clients with some general setup and process information.  We have recently updated and added to our online videos which now provide excellent step by step instructions and important information to help your Council.
Please click on the link to our 'Online Training Videos' above or call us on 1300 219 552 if you require further support or documentation.
The Reflect software developed by Asset Edge is the leading inspection and  maintenance management software utilised by local and state governments in Australia.
Reflect is a user friendly and feature rich software product that can be used for the planning, recording and analysis of maintenance activities for any class of asset.
The software has been developed using state of the art Microsoft.NET

and mobile-SQL  server  technology.  This provides users with an extraordinarily rich variety of functionality and yet manages to maintain a simple to use interface enabling an enterprise-wide software solution for use in both the field and office environments.

The Vigil software developed by Asset Edge is designed for State Government Road Authorities to perform Contractor Surveillance. In most Australian States work is carried out on classified Roads by Local Government, large fixed term Contracts and the authorities own delivery teams.

Nemus is the newest Smartphone/Web solution developed by Asset Edge to manage your council’s tree register and assist field officers with tree inspections and reporting. Trees under the control of Local Government are increasingly being recognised as significant and valuable assets that require ongoing and committed asset management practices as per the legislative guidelines and local council policy.

The process of obtaining and managing accurate records to assist in decision making, planning and risk mitigation is now required by insurers and horticultural departments. Nemus has been developed in association with industry experts in horticulture and information technology to produce this powerful and new Tree Management System.

Signum is the latest Andriod/Web mobile solution developed by Asset Edge. It is the result of frequent requests from local government organisations in Victoria, New South Wales and Queensland to easily and accurately record the placement, checking and removal of temporary signage on their road networks.

It is most suitable for: Road closures (changeable/temporary signs), Temporary speed zone signage, Traffic hazards and other warning signs, Signs for remote supervision, Changeable notice boards (Fire, Police, etc), Detours and changed traffic conditions, Portable traffic lights and message boards

Tamworth Regional Council’s Maintenance and Construction team has implemented a new smart software solution to improve efficiency and achieve inspection and maintenance objectives across a diverse range of assets.
Cairns Regional Council in Far North Queensland has taken a proactive stance and is now well prepared for natural disasters for years to come.

Each year Asset Edge hold user group conferences in various locations across Australia. We aim to share the latest enhancements of the core solutions in use across our customer base and provide a forum for discussion which guides future development of these solutions.

We promote the inventiveness of other councils with their extensive usage of the Reflect product across countless Asset types. Our UGC's run over 1.5 days and our Conference Dinner allows time for everyone to socialise.
Maybe we'll see you at next years conference?
to go directly to our Conference News page

A Signum licence will cost $2500  (excl GST) per annum for an organisation. This price includes version upgrades during the year and allows for an unlimited number of Android devices to have the Signum software installed , plus access to the web based viewer.
Information about the signage, along with a photo and GPS coordinates are captured on a smartphone in seconds.
The data is then sent back to the office  or depot where the details can be viewed from a desktop computer.

Signum will run on almost any Android smartphone or tablet. It uses the internal GPS to the record the position, date and time of when the sign was either placed, checked or picked up. All signage can be easily viewed on a desktop through the Signum Web application.
Nemus is the newest Smartphone/Web solution developed by Asset Edge to manage your council’s tree register and assist field officers with tree inspections and reporting.

Trees under the control of Local Government are increasingly being recognised as significant and valuable assets that require ongoing and committed asset management practices as per the legislative guidelines and local council policy.
The process of obtaining and managing accurate records to assist in decision making, planning and risk mitigation is now required by insurers and horticultural departments.
Nemus has been developed in association with industry experts in horticulture and information technology to produce this powerful and new Tree Management System.

A Nemus licence will cost $3000 (excl GST) per annum for your organisation. This price includes any version upgrades during the year and allows for an unlimited number of mobile devices , help desk support , plus access to the dedicated council web based viewer.
To access the Nemus Demo site simply download the Nemus - Quick Start Guide below. Here you will find access details for both web and android systems as well as a guide on how to get started.
